heading: No Proper Documentation for Previous Work
content: We didn't have any propper documentation before this point, so writing down everything which already have been done. The idea was clear. We wanted to build a 6-wheel rover, which would be equipped with various sensors and would be able to find the shortest route given a destination. We had the model ready, (shown in the attached image). Now we divided into two groups: One group will build the rover and the other will train it on simulation.

heading: Cutting Rods and Starting to Build the Structure
content: Given the 3-D structure of rover, we started taking measurements of the aluminuim rods we have and calculating the appropriate sizes for least wastage. After marking the rods we took out the metal cutter and cut the rods. The new club members were taught how to use the metal cutter. All safety precautions were followed including safety googles and gloves.

heading: Joining the Rods to Build the Structure
content: A discussion on how to join the metals tok place. Due to unavailability of any kind of welding equipment we had to use nuts and bolts, compromising the strength of the structure. The bolts we planed to use won't be enough so we put a request for purchase. Goal for next session - complete the basic structure of the rover.
